item.title: Using Bulma.io Modal's in Rails
item.description: Having recently used a new CSS framework, Bulma.io, I thought I’d write a little about my experience using the framework and how I managed to get the Modal component working in my project. Bulma.io is the product of one individual, Jeremy Thomas, and is completely open-source and free to use. I wanted to use a framework that was more lightweight than some of the more famous ones such as bootstrap or foundation.

item.title: Entry Point
item.description: I’m working on some projects and will be documenting my journey creating them in this blog. I’m looking forward to sharing what I learn with you! In the meantime, please check me out on Github. Come back soon! “Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.” - Patrick McKenzie

item.title: About
item.description: Self-taught web developer living in the beautiful Piedmont of NC class matt_king belongs_to: [:beautiful_daughter, :lovely_wife] def initialize @interests = ['hiking', 'cooking', 'reading', 'gaming', 'coding'] @birth_place = 'Asheville, North Carolina' end def current_stats @age = 35 @career = 'web developer' @place = 'Raleigh, North Carolina' end def skill_set @programming_languages = ['Ruby', 'JavaScript', 'Go'] @frameworks = {front_end: 'Bulma, Bootstrap', back_end: 'Rails'} end end
